section.title: Introduction
section.para: An intermediate file is a file that is output from one SMOKE program and input to another SMOKE program. All other files output from programs are considered output files; these are documented in .

In this chapter, the intermediate files are organized under headings named for the SMOKE programs that create the files; the files are listed alphabetically within each program section. The order of the programs within the chapter is also alphabetical. Please note that some file types have multiple file names, one per source category. For example, the multiplicative control matrix file name is ACMAT, MCMAT, or PCMAT, depending on whether the area, mobile, or point source category is being processed by Cntlmat. In these cases of multiple names for a single file type, the file description is listed one time for all intermediate files.
The Cntlmat program is responsible for creating the growth and control matrices. Cntlmat creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: ACMAT, MCMAT, and PCMAT
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Grwinven, Smkmerge, and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for ACMAT, MCMAT, and PCMAT

row.entry: Number of sources in the inventory
NROWS3D from the AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Number of pollutants that have control factors
The contents of the GCNTL file indicate which pollutants will be controlled.

table.title: Variables in ACMAT, MCMAT, and PCMAT

section.title: APMAT, MPMAT, and PPMAT
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Grwinven, Smkmerge, Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for APMAT, MPMAT, and PPMAT

row.entry: Number of sources in the inventory
NROWS3D from the AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file

table.title: Variables in APMAT, MPMAT, and PPMAT

section.title: ARMAT, MRMAT, and PRMAT
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Grwinven and Smkmerge

table.title: I/O API Header for ARMAT, MRMAT, and PRMAT

row.entry: Number of reactivity species plus the four base variables
The contents of the GSPRO file

table.title: Variables in ARMAT, MRMAT, and PRMAT

row.entry: UNITS from the AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Inventory pollutant combined with model species name
Inventory pollutant combined with model species name

section.para: The Elevpoint program is responsible for selecting the elevated sources. Elevpoint creates the following intermediate files:
Type: ASCII - list-directed
Used by: Laypoint, Smkmerge, and Smkreport

table.title: File columns in PELV

row.entry: Source number for elevated source, zero if a PinG source
Source number for PinG source, zero if simply an elevated source

section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Laypoint and Smkmerge

table.title: I/O API Header for STACK_GROUPS
Variables in STACK_GROUPS

section.para: The Emisfac program is responsible for generating on-road mobile emission factors. Emisfac creates the following intermediate files.

section.title: MOBILE6 intermediate files
section.para: Type: ASCII
Used by: MOBILE6

Emisfac creates a MOBILE6 input file that is read and processing by the MOBILE6 library. MOBILE6 also creates several files while it is running. These files are all placed in the $SMK_M6PATH directory.

section.title: Emission factor files
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Temporal

table.title: I/O API Header for emission factor files

row.entry: Number of on-road mobile sources using activity data
Number of emission process and pollutant combinations + 1 (for source IDs)

table.title: Variables in STACK_GROUPS

row.entry: Emission factor for this source and process/pollutant 1
Emission factor for this source and process/pollutant NVARS3D-1

section.para: The Grdmat program is responsible for creating the gridding matrix. Grdmat creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: AGMAT, MGMAT, and PGMAT
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Smkmerge and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for AGMAT, MGMAT, and PGMAT

tgroup.comment: this isn't right - the gridding matrix is more complicated

row.entry: Determined by the grid and the sources in the inventory
Number of cells in the grid
Number of columns times number of rows in the grid

table.title: Variables in AGMAT, MGMAT, and PGMAT

section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Mbsetup, Premobl, and Temporal
The ungridding matrix is used to produce county-level meteorology data from gridded files.
The Grwinven program is responsible for applying growth and controls to the inventory. Grwinven creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: AREA_O, MOBL_O and PNTS_O
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Cntlmat, Elevpoint, Emisfac, Grdmat, Grwinven, Laypoint, Mbsetup, Premobl, Smkmerge, Spcmat, and Temporal

table.title: I/O API Header for AREA_O, MOBL_O, and PNTS_O

row.entry: NROWS3D from the AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Number of variables in the file

table.title: Variables in AREA_O, MOBL_O, and PNTS_O

row.entry: Use week, month temporal profiles or not
Year of inventory for this record
Longitude at beginning of link (mobile only)
Latitude at beginning of link (mobile only)
Longitude at end of link (mobile only)
Latitude at end of link (mobile only)
Ozone season emissions for pollutant NVARS3D
Control efficiency fraction for pollutant NVARS3D
Rule effectiveness fraction for pollutant NVARS3D
Rule penetration fraction for pollutant NVARS3D

section.title: ARINV_O, MBINV_O, MBINV_AO, PTINV_O
section.para: Type: ASCII - column-specific
Used by: Smkinven
See for the formats of the ARINV, MBINV, and PTINV files.
The Laypoint program is responsible for computing layer fractions for point sources. Laypoint creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: PLAY and PLAY_EX
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Smkmerge and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for PLAY and PLAY_EX

row.entry: Number of point sources or number of explicit sources
Number of sources in the PNTS file, or number of explicit sources in the PHOUR file

table.title: Variables in PLAY and PLAY_EX

row.entry: Fraction of plume emitted into layer

section.para: The Mbsetup program is responsible for creating inputs for the Premobl and Emisfac programs. Mbsetup creates the following intermediate files:
Type: ASCII - column-specific
Used by: Premobl and Emisfac

table.title: File columns in SPDSUM

row.entry: Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed
Source number with given FIPS, road class, and speed

section.para: *If line ends with a backward slash (\) then the next line is additional sources with the same FIPS, road class, and speed.

section.title: DAILYGROUP, WEEKLYGROUP, MONTHLYGROUP, and EPISODEGROUP
section.para: Type: ASCII - list-directed
Used by: Premobl and Emisfac

table.title: File columns in DAILYGROUP, WEEKLYGROUP, MONTHLYGROUP, and EPISODEGROUP

section.para: The Normbeis3 program is responsible for computing normalized biogenic emissions. Normbeis3 creates the following intermediate file:
Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Tmpbeis3

table.title: I/O API Header for B3GRD

row.entry: Number of rows in the grid
NROWS3D from the gridded land use file
Number of columns in the grid
NCOLS3D from the gridded land use file
Number of biogenic emission species times the number of seasons modeled

table.title: Variables in B3GRD

section.para: The Premobl program is responsible for preprocessing temperatures for the Emisfac program. Premobl creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: Hourly temperature profile files
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Emisfac

table.title: I/O API Header for hourly temperature files

row.entry: Number of reference counties for this time period group
DAILYGROUP, WEEKLYGROUP, MONTHLYGROUP, and EPISODEGROUP files

table.title: Variables in hourly temperature files

section.para: The Rawbio program is responsible for computing normalized biogenic emissions. Rawbio creates the following intermediate file:

section.title: BGRD (summer) or BGRDW (winter)
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Tmpbio

table.title: I/O API Header for BGRD and BGRDW

row.entry: Number of rows in the grid
NROWS3D from the gridded land use file
Number of columns in the grid
NCOLS3D from the gridded land use file

table.title: Variables in BGRD and BGRDW

section.para: The Smkinven program is responsible for importing the raw inventory into SMOKE format. Smkinven creates the following intermediate files:

section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Cntlmat, Elevpoint, Emisfac, Grdmat, Grwinven, Laypoint, Mbsetup, Premobl, Smkmerge, Smkreport, Spcmat, and Temporal

table.title: I/O API Header for AREA, MOBL, and PNTS

row.entry: NROWS3D from the AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Number of variables in the file

table.title: Variables in AREA, MOBL, and PNTS

row.entry: Use week, month temporal profiles or not
Year of inventory for this record
Longitude at beginning of link (mobile only)
Latitude at beginning of link (mobile only)
Longitude at end of link (mobile only)
Latitude at end of link (mobile only)
Ozone season emissions for pollutant NVARS3D
Control efficiency fraction for pollutant NVARS3D
Rule effectiveness fraction for pollutant NVARS3D
Rule penetration fraction for pollutant NVARS3D

PTDAY or PTHOUR files read in by Smkinven

section.para: The Smkmerge program is responsible for creating model-ready emissions files. Smkmerge creates the following intermediate file:
Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Mrggrid and Smkmerge
These files can be model-ready emissions files by source category or all categories. See for format information.
The Spcmat program is responsible for creating speciation matrices. Spcmat creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: ASMAT_S, MSMAT_S, and PSMAT_S
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Smkmerge and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for ASMAT_S, MSMAT_S, and PSMAT_S

row.entry: Determined by AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Number of inventory pollutants combine with output species

table.title: Variables in ASMAT_S, MSMAT_S, and PSMAT_S

Used by: Smkmerge and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for ASMAT_L, MSMAT_L, and PSMAT_L

row.entry: Determined by AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Number of inventory pollutants combine with output species

table.title: Variables in ASMAT_L, MSMAT_L, and PSMAT_L

section.para: The Temporal program is responsible for generating hourly emissions by source. Temporal creates the following intermediate file:

section.title: ATMP, MTMP, and PTMP
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Smkmerge and Smkreport

table.title: I/O API Header for ATMP, MTMP, and PTMP

row.entry: Determined by AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file
Determined by AREA, MOBL, or PNTS file

table.title: Variables in ATMP, MTMP, and PTMP

section.para: The Tmpbeis3 is responsible for creating gridded, hourly biogenic emissions. Tmpbeis3 creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: B3GTS_L and B3GTS_S
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Mrggrid and Smkmerge
These files are model-ready output, but can be input into Mrggrid or Smkmerge to be combined with other source category model-ready files. See for format information.
The Tmpbio is responsible for creating gridded, hourly biogenic emissions. Tmpbio creates the following intermediate files:

section.title: BGTS_L and BGTS_S
section.para: Type: I/O API NetCDF - adapted gridded format
Used by: Mrggrid and Smkmerge
These files are model-ready output, but can be input into Mrggrid or Smkmerge to be combined with other source category model-ready files. See for format information.
